instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
threads.message:
Hi fellows, I have a mac pro 2936 which has both PPBus G3H as well as 3.42 line but no red light. Any tip for troubleshooting? Can we still have power in de <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and maybe the one wire adapter sense is not good, or would there be no power on 3.42 if some part of the circuit is damaged? Sorry for the noob question:)

Edit i also noticed <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR> is missing but that wont be powered anyway without the system starting,i gues

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
threads.message: Green light is ok then???? <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR> has nothing to do with green/orange light but it should be present ......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
threads.message: No there is no light at all but i do measure G3H and 3.42V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
threads.message:
That means SMC is running.
1) Did you try a known good magsafe board? 
2) <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> pin 1 and 2 got 3V?
3) <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR> got 3V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
threads.message:
1) yes
2) yes we have put pin 5 is burned incl trace, I guess thats a problem, no 3.42v here
3) yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No red light
threads.message: I assume you fixed this by replacing <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> and fixing the trace?

threads.message: Hey Duke, its still on the pile ;) will try it over the weekend. I have another troublesome board at hands will post a new topic for that.

threads.message: You havent seen the board yet, its a pile of crap:) it was "fixed" before and previous shop borrowed some chips, also liquid damaged many chips have a nice shitty color. Might give it a try over the weekend, it is a challenge :)
